title: EN - Curiosity Killed the Cat: (5XMs) Short Story Challenges (A2-B2 / 2e jaar tot 3e jaar)
description: Verschillende schrijven opdrachten in het Engels. Niveau A2 tot B2, dus meer 2e en 3e jaar leerlingen.

items.content:
Waarom zou je voor deze quest willen kiezen?

  • .......je graag wilt weten hoe je een korte verhaal kan schrijven.
  • .......je graag je Engels wilt verbeteren.
  • .......je graag wilt in het Engels spreken en schrijven.
  • .......je graag je curiosity wilt gebruiken om iets in het Engels te maken.

Waar gaat deze quest over?

Deze quest gaat over de gebruiken van nieuwsgierigheid om creatief in je leven te zijn.

Hij hoort bij het domein talen - Engels.

Je leert verschillende methoden om je creatief process te verbeteren. Je doet dit via schrijven en praten in het Engels.

Welke producten moet je leveren?

Voor deze quest moet je de volgende producten leveren:

Verschillende schrijf opdrachten in het Engels.

Korte verhalen.

VERWACHTING VOORDAT JE BEGINT

Deze quest wordt ondersteund met een bloX en een chatgroep via Teams.

  • Zorg dat je jezelf inschrijft voor de bloX (soms gebeurt dit automatisch, maar niet altijd)

  • De coach die deze quest begeleidt nodigt jou uit voor de chatgroep in Teams.

eXplore miles

Deze quest levert jou 5 eXplore miles als je hem helemaal doorloopt, alle stappen zet en alles op tijd levert.

Leerdoelen voor Short Stories:

For working together in class:

For writing the short stories:

How will you be graded?

Look at the rubric below. This is how you will grade yourself for this Quest. Do you think you will score Ontwikkelend or better in all categories? You must score Ontwikkelend or better in order to complete this Quest.

Make a screenshot of this rubric. Give yourself a score for each of these sections. Write at least 4 sentences IN ENGLISH about why you think you will score at this level. Post this in seesaw/egodact.

Beheersend

Ontwikkelend

Beginnend

Plastic

Word Count

Has between 300 - 600 words per short story, possibly even more!

Has around 300 words or more per short story.

Has not yet been able to write enough, but has obviously tried.

Has only a few sentences.

Layout & structure

Has explained which what they will write about and how. Uses paragraphs and good punctuation.

There is some sort of structure but could be improved by using paragraphs or subheadings.

The writing is somewhat coherent and follows a pattern, but no obvious effort to structure anything.

A blob of text.

Use of grammar

Has clearly understood and explained the grammar rules. Is able to use them to explain their ideas.

The use of grammar is often correct, with small mistakes throughout the text.

The content of the essay is coherent, but there are plenty of errors that should be improved.

Copy and pasted from Google translate. Text is not understandable due to mistakes.

Ideas & insights

Student understands the idea of the Quest. Has written interesting/ personal/ comprehensive thoughts that show a deeper understanding of the topic.

Student has attempted to dive into the topic. Shared ideas and personal accounts.

Student has not fully understood the task. Has written about basic ideas, but unable to link to personal beliefs, global differences, or understanding of theme.

The student has not understood the assignment or has misunderstood what the topic is about.
Speaking (bloX) I can use my speaking skills to adapt my language to the person I'm speaking to. With more and more confidence, I can change my voice and facial expressions to express emotion in English. I can sometimes use my speaking skills to adapt my language to the person I'm speaking to, but not always. I can sometimes change my voice and facial expressions to express emotion in English. I try to use my speaking skills to adapt language to the person I'm speaking to, but it doesn't always work. Changing my voice and facial expressions to express emotion in English is also hard for me. I can't use speaking skills to adapt my language to the person I am speaking with. I can't change my voice and facial expressions to express emotion in English.

Routeplanner:

Tijdschema voor 5 XMs (ongeveer):

1. Motivatie/verderkijker/rubric/braindump opdrachten: 30-45 minuten.

2. bloX: 1 hour and 30 minutes.

3. 1st Short Story: 1 hour.

4. 2nd Short Story: 1 hour.

5. Afronding: update rubric: 30 minutes. Terugkijker: 30 minutes.

Motivatiemotor

➜ Maak een tegel aan in Egodact. Beschrijf daarin waarom je deze quest tot een goed einde zou willen brengen.

DON'T FORGET TO WRITE THIS ALL IN ENGLISH

In deze quest ga je ontdekken hoe je korte verhalen kan schrijven en je nieuwscherigheid gebruiken om plezier in schrijven te vinden.

➜ Opdrachten staan in zo'n grijs blok als deze. Lees die eerst goed voor je die gaat maken. Hier is je eerste opdracht:
Schrijf in het Engels onder "voorbereiden" in je egodact tegel alles die je al over korte verhaal schrijven weet. Heb je al een idee over hoe je een korte verhaal zou kunnen schrijven? Schrijf dat ook maar op. Schrijf minimaal 4 zinnen.

DON'T FORGET TO WRITE THIS ALL IN ENGLISH

Onderzoek

Make sure you sign up for one bloX in the first few weeks of the period. In the bloX, you will:

  • Learn how to organize a short story.
  • Choose the storyline via chance.
  • Play a game together to help spark your curiosity and inspiration.

Verwerking

Write your first Short Story IN ENGLISH:

First, watch this video which shows what we are going to do in class for the bloX using Rory's Story Cubes and your curiosity! Remember, you are going to get the basics of your story in class down and then further write your short stories from this.

Reflective journal

➜ Fill in your reflective journal in Egodact with answers to the following questions:
  • Question 1. What was your strategy for outlining your story? How did you use the Story Cubes to make this happen? Were you inspired and curious?
  • Question 2. Did you enjoy writing a story? Was it different than just reading a story? Would you like to use Story Cubes again in the future?

Make sure you sign up for one bloX in the first few weeks of the period. In the bloX, you will:

  • Learn how to organize a short story.
  • Choose the storyline via chance.
  • Play a game together to help spark your curiosity and inspiration.

Verwerking

Write your second Short Story IN ENGLISH using the feedback you received from Mr. Baldwin or Mr. Esmeijer from your first short story:

Use this Website to roll your next story inspiration: https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/158896002

Post a photo of your dice in Egodact. Post an outline of your story from the dice in Edogact. Write your short story between 200-500 words and post in Egodact. Send a message to Mr. Esmeijer or Mr. Baldwin to ask for feedback.

Are you CONFUSED? Does this make no sense at all? Make sure you sign up for one of the blox in the first two weeks of the period. In these bloX, Mr. Baldwin will show you methods of writing a good essay and coach you through your essay writing. You must come to at least one of these bloX.

Reflective journal

➜ Fill in your reflective journal in Egodact with answers to the following questions:

  • Question 1. What was your strategy for outlining your story? How did you use the Story Cubes to make this happen? Were you inspired and curious?
  • Question 2. Did you enjoy writing a story? Was it different than just reading a story? Would you like to use Story Cubes again in the future?

How did you do?

Look at the rubric below. You must score Ontwikkelend or better in order to complete this Quest.

Make a screenshot of this rubric. Give yourself a score for each of these sections. Write at least 4 sentences IN ENGLISH about why you think you scored at this level. Post this in seesaw/egodact.

Beheersend

Ontwikkelend

Beginnend

Plastic

Has between 300 - 600 words per short story, possibly even more!

Has around 300 words or more per short story.

Has not yet been able to write enough, but has obviously tried.

Has only a few sentences.

Layout & structure

Has explained which what they will write about and how. Uses paragraphs and good punctuation.

There is some sort of structure but could be improved by using paragraphs or subheadings.

The writing is somewhat coherent and follows a pattern, but no obvious effort to structure anything.

A blob of text.

Use of grammar

Has clearly understood and explained the grammar rules. Is able to use them to explain their ideas.

The use of grammar is often correct, with small mistakes throughout the text.

The content of the essay is coherent, but there are plenty of errors that should be improved.

Copy and pasted from Google translate. Text is not understandable due to mistakes.

Ideas & insights

Student understands the idea of the Quest. Has written interesting/ personal/ comprehensive thoughts that show a deeper understanding of the topic.

Student has attempted to dive into the topic. Shared ideas and personal accounts.

Student has not fully understood the task. Has written about basic ideas, but unable to link to personal beliefs, global differences, or understanding of theme.

The student has not understood the assignment or has misunderstood what the topic is about.

With more and more confidence, I can change my voice and facial expressions to express emotion in English. I can sometimes use my speaking skills to adapt my language to the person I'm speaking to, but not always. I can sometimes change my voice and facial expressions to express emotion in English. I try to use my speaking skills to adapt language to the person I'm speaking to, but it doesn't always work. Changing my voice and facial expressions to express emotion in English is also hard for me. I can't use speaking skills to adapt my language to the person I am speaking with.
